In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's how you can define the `clean_column` function in Julia to clean a column name as described:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase and strip leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = lowercase(strip(col))
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned column name. It first lowers the case of the string and strips any leading or trailing whitespaces. Then it replaces spaces and hyphens with an underscore.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column(" my column ")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"
```

This function is flexible enough to handle various forms of the input, ensuring that the resulting column name is in lowercase with underscores instead of spaces or hyphens.
